titlestmt.titleproper: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Audiovisual Materials, RG 7
A Guide to the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Audiovisual Materials, RG 7 FA1801

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Audiovisual Materials, RG 7

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 7 contains the collection's audiovisual records. They include photographs and slides created for annual reports and newsletters, videos of Knight Foundation events and grant-related projects, and audiotapes of interviews.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Throughout this sub-group, printed copies or contact sheets accompany the material on the disks and have been described accordingly. In some cases, a disk was incorrectly filed (e.g. a DVD filed under the CD-ROM series). The incorrect filing was preserved because this scenario exists in cases where multiple disks were used to record the same event/person and were grouped into the same series, despite being on different formats. The reverse is also true for example, disks representing the same person/event may be in two separate series because they were organized by media type. This sub-group is not the only place to find legacy digital material, it represents an earlier organizational effort to group non-paper material into its own record group. Additional legacy digital media can be found throughout each series of the Knight Foundation records.

did.unittitle: 50th Anniversary, John S. and James L. Knight Foundation - Printed Index to CD-ROMS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 50th Anniversary, John S. and James L. Knight Foundation, ten CD-ROMs of historical images, including Charles and Clara Knight (parents of JS and JLK); JSK as a child, young man, and with his children, wives, and grandchildren; JLK as young man, with his wife and children (including images at his daughters' weddings and during family vacations). Also images of JSK and JLK at work (meeting of the BOD of Knight-Ridder, at the Akron Beacon Journal, at the Miami Herald ground breaking ceremony, etc.) and at work-related events (including images of JSK with John F. Kennedy, Richard Nixon, and JSK and JLK with Lee Hills, Ben Maidenburg, Alvah Chapman, C.C. Gibson, etc. (four folders with index). The images were copied from the personal collections of children of James L. Knight, the Archives of the University of Akron and the Knight Fdn Archives and other sources. (Photographs of some of the scanned images were placed in the Archives photo collection).

did.unittitle: Summit Artspace Reception Announcing Akron Arts Grants

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs taken at reception announcing grants of $700,000 to Akron arts groups, including a major grant to renovate the Summit Artspace, which is housed in the old Akron Beacon Journal offices. Announcement was part of a launch of Knight's new national arts program and featured remarks by Dennis Scholl. Several trustees and staff members were in attendance.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item was imaged from a CD-R in 2023.

did.unittitle: John S. Knight Speech to the Akron Chamber of Commerce

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Digital copy of an audiotape of a 1958 speech by John Knight at the Golden Anniversary meeting of the Chamber. Included is a transcript of the entire meeting (79 minutes, 54 seconds). Mr. Knight spoke of Akron's past, his father, and current events, both local and national.

did.unittitle: John S. Knight Speech to the Akron Chamber of Commerce - Printed Version
John S. Knight Speeches - Preceedings at John S. Knight Testimonial Dinner, Sheraton Hotel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Digital copies of several audiotapes: 1) Proceedings at John S. Knight Testimonial Dinner, November 16, 1964 at the Sheraton Hotel in Akron, OH. Includes remarks by James L. Knight, an introduction by E.J. Thomas and remarks by John S. Knight, looking back on his fifty year career in the newspaper business. (79:55 minutes) Includes a transcript of the audiotape. 2) John S. Knight's Question and Answer Session at the Poor Richard Club, January 17, 1972, in Philadelphia, PA. Knight answers written questions on current events and the future of the United States. (28:06 minutes). Both files were copied from the JSK collection, University of Akron.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item was imaged from a CD-R in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DVD discs re: Mississippi Rebuilding Forum hosted by the Governor's commission on recovery, rebuilding and renewal. The forum's charge was to come up with ideas and suggestions for the communities to use in their rebuilding and renewal in order to create a Mississippi even better than what Hurricane Katrina had destroyed. Plannners and architects from across America and Europe teamed with local professionals, civic leaders and citizens to create this set of tools to enable Mississippi to rise again as an example of the best and most beautiful communities America has to offer.

did.unittitle: Final Edition: Journalism According to Jack & Jim Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video documentary which tells the story of the Knight family, the Akron Beacon Journal and the rise and fall of Knight-Ridder. Produced and written by Paul Jacoway and Kathleen Endres and directed by Paul Jacoway. Knight Foundation archives material was used for the documentary. Excerpts from an oral history with Jack Knight are heard (the archives contains a transcript of the interview). Also included are interviews with Alberto Ibarguen, Gerald Austen, Marjorie Crane, Gene Roberts and Larry Jinks. Footage includes many pictures of the Knight brothers and other Knight Foundation officers, included Lee Hills, Jim Batten, and Alvah Chapman. One hour in length. NOTE: Jacoway has granted KF permission to post it on its website.

did.unittitle: Bill Moyers Report: Sports for Sale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bill Moyers special, "Sports for Sale" on abuses in college basketball and football programs. The first half of the tape consists of the documentary. The second half is a panel discussion about the recommendations featured in the Knight Commission on ICA report released that day. Father Hesburgh and William Friday, co-chairs of the commission, are included in the panel discussion, as are Dick Schultz, Executive Director of the NCAA, former college president, Clifton Wharton, Jr., football coach LaVell Edwards and author Murray Sperber.

did.unittitle: World Press Institute Roundtable Discussion - Tape A-1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Roundtable discussion opens with introductory remarks by Hodding Carter on America's response to attack and infringement on civil liberties. Eric Newton then described the Knight Foundation's Journalism program. Fellows, from the countries of Argentina, Cameroon, China, Finland, Germany, India, Romania, Turkey and Zimbabwe, then were free to ask questions of Knight staff or comment on the situation in their respective countries. Participants: Teresa Bausili (La Nacion, Argentina), Bertrand Tchoumi (TBC Radio, Cameroon), Jinmei Lu (Shanghai Broadcasting Network, China), Kaius Niemi (Helsingin Sanomat, Finland), Lars VonTorne (Der Tagesspiegel, Germany), Shujaat Bukhari (The Hindu, India), Oliver-Tamas Kiss (Szabadsag, Romania), Nevin Sungur (NTV, Turkey), Patience Rusere (The Chronicle, Zimbabwe).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The audio-portion is poor; many participants are difficult to hear.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a news program produced by the Poynter Institute for Media Studies in 1986 on the Knight-Ridder Company and hosted by John Chancellor. It provides some history of the company and features interviews with James L. Knight, Alvah Chapman, and Jim Batten. The Knight Foundation is mentioned as a large shareholder of Knight-Ridder. Much of the emphasis is on the impact of public vs. private ownership of newspapers. Also mentioned is the launch of Gannett's USA TODAY and its impact on the newspaper business. Jim Knight closes the program with the quote: "Change is coming. I hope its minor." This was probably one of the last interviews JLK gave.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six images (copies) of the Miami Herald's press room operations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autographed photo of C. Blake McDowell and Smith Davis taken at time of dedication of Miami Herald building.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Knight Ridder banquet (attendees include Lee and Tina Hills, Creed Black, Jim Batten, Larry Jinks, etc.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph, b/w, of John W. Chandler, Chairman, Knight Foundation Advisory Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph, b/w, of Virginia Dodge Fielder, Journalism Advisory Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contact sheet and one 8"x10" photograph of Richard Gilman, former advisor on the Excellence in Education program to the Knight Foundation. Black and white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Burl Osborne, former member of the Knight Foundation Journalism Advisory Committee (retired 1998). Black & white photos (one 8"x10", multiple 5"x7" copies of the same image) and the negative.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of Lewis Owens, formerly community advisor for Lexington, Kentucky to the Knight Foundation. Black & white photo, 5"x7".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Richard Wald, former member of the Journalism Advisory Committlee, who retired in 1998. Includes two color portraits (8x10, 5x7) and a negative.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Rosental Calmon Alves, holder of the Knight Chair at the University of Texas as of 1/16/96. Includes photos of Alves teaching, talking with students, and portraits. Black & white and color. Some negatives included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of David Broder, holder of the Knight Chair at Duke University, 1993. Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of Stephen K. Doig, holder of Knight Chair in Computer-Assisted Journalism at Arizona State University. Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of John Ginn, holder of the Knight Chair at the University of Kansas, ca. 1991. Black & white. Negative

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of William Raspberry, holder of the Knight Chair at Duke University, 1995. Photo by the Washington Post. Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of Joseph E. Ritchie, holder of the Knight Chair at the Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University, 1992. Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three folders of copies of Knight Historical photographs, many of which were used in the John S. Knight biography: 1) Knight family 2) Knight brothers (some in groups) 3) Knight trustees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photos of Charles Landon Knight, father of the Knight brothers. Consists of one b&w image of Charles with his wife Clara in Atlantic City, June 5, 1907 and three undated photos (b&w) taken at a later age, two showing him with pipe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three undated photograph of Clara I. Knight, mother of John S. and James L. Knight. Includes two portraits, ca. 1890s-1900s (one taken in Atlantic City.) (See portraits, Knight, C.L. for a portrait of Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Knight taken in Atlantic City). Black & white. One undated color photograph signed in the back "Aunt Clara Knight" with two letters from Mary Ellen Hunter, friend of the Knight Family explaining the relationship between the Knight and Hunter family.

did.unittitle: Knight Brothers (John S. and James L. Knight)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eleven b&w and color photos of the Knight brothers: 1) JS & JL at a black-tie dinner, with CC Gibson and Tina Hills; 2) Knight papers go public, NYSE, JS & JL with Lee Hills, 1969; 3) JS & JL (wearing straw hats) at the dedication of the James L. Knight International Center, University of Miami; 4) JS & JL with Blake McDowell, holding silver plate, at 75th Dinner; 5) JS & JL in front of new Miami Herald Building, Miami, 4/1963; JS & JL, with group of friends in Akron; 6) JS & JL in press room (includes negative & copies (5x3); 7) JS & JL (in black tie) in front of a picture of a Knight; 8) JS & JL, with JS's son, Landon; 9) JS & JL, with Lee Hills and Alvah Chapman, 1973; 10) Knight family gathering in Akron, includes Clara, JS & JL, 1938; 11) JS & JL in group of men, around table, at a Knight newspapers board meeting. Also includes copies of these and other Knight brother photos duplicated in very high resolution on cd.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three copies of a black and white photograph of an etching of John S. Knight in profile. Knight is about 75 in the etching.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sixteen b&w photos of John S. Knight: 1) JS as toddler, in dress; 2) JS as young boy, playing in snow, with dog; 3/4) JS in suit as young boy; 5) JS in group picture of football team (first row, left) - High School State Champions, 1913; 6) JS (in broad-brimmed hat) on boat trip with friends; 7) JS, WWII; 8) John S. Knight, Jr. in WWII uniform; 9) JS and Beryl Knight in winners' circle, Gulfstream Park, with race horse, 3/25/1961?; 10) JS with Tina Hills, 12/1964; 11) JS dancing with Mary Ann Knight, 12/1964; 12) JS with Tina Hills, Rad Crane, family, at Indian Creek Club, 12/1979; 13) JS Knight III as toddler; 14) JS's children at a young age; 15) JSK children, 1938; 16) JS and JSKIII

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several informal photographs of John S. Knight, JSK at his Underwood typewriter, with Blake McDowell, etc. (ca. 1940s); with Richard Nixon, receiving an honorary degree, etc. (ca. 1950s); on the cover of Newsweek (4/25/1955); with Jackie Gleason and Miami Herald events (1960s); portraits and an image of his Pulitzer Prize certificate (1968). Also a portrait (1970s, Akron Beacon Journal, black & white), a color portrait of Mr. Knight with his brother James (1970s, Miami Herald photo by Battle Vaughn), and an image of JSK speaking at an unidentified event at the Herald-Leader (ca. 1980, Creed Black, Alvah Chapman, and Bernard Ridder are seated in the background). There also is one color transparency of JSK with an unidentified couple. (two folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black and white portrait of John S. Knight, c. 1970. Donated by Tina Hills (removed from frame).

did.unittitle: Knight, John S. with John F. Kennedy, Lee Hills at IAPA Event

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three b&w photos of President John F. Kennedy, taken at an Inter-American Press Association (IAPA) event four days before JFK's assassination: 1) JS with JFK; 2) JFK with JS, Lee Hills, and Beryl Knight; Lee Hills and JFK.

did.unittitle: Knight, John S. with Beryl Zoller Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three b&w photos of John S. Knight with his second wife, Beryl Zoller Knight: 1) at the University Club, in a crowd, c. 1947-49; 2) JS and Beryl sitting at a table; 3) JS and Beryl in box seats at race track.

did.unittitle: Knight, John S. with Betty Augustus Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two b&w photos of John S. Knight and his third wife, Elizabeth (Betty) Augustus Knight, undated but probably 1970s: 1) seated; 2) cutting cake at celebration of 85th anniversary of Akron Beacon Journal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three b&w photos (all the same) of John S. Knight, Jr. as a prep-school boxer. The photos were donated by J. Barnett Woodruff, former classmate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three copies of a black and white photograph of an etching of James L. Knight in profile. Knight is about 60 in the etching.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eleven b&w photos of James L. Knight, personal photos and with family members: 1) a young JL with friend c. 1929; 2) JL with daughter Barbara, 1939; 3) JL and wife, Mary Ann, saving a sea turtle, 1940s; 4/5) JL and daughter Marjorie with sailboat, c. 1940s; 6) JL & Mary Ann, with daughters Marilyn (Deedee) and Barbara, c. 1940s; 7) JL & Mary Ann fishing with daughters Marilyn, Barbara and Marjorie, 1954; 8) JL and Mary Ann at debutante ball with daughter Barbara, 1955; 9) Mary Ann skeet shooting, c. 1950s; 10/11) JL fishing, 1958

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of James L. Knight, including photos by Battle Vaughan (Miami Herald staff photo), by Tony Spina (Detroit Free Press, 8/14/1969), and of JLK with Danny Martin and Creed Black by E. Martin Jessee (Herald Leader). Also includes images of JLK as a young man, a portrait (ca. 1960s) and with Lee Hills, C.C. Gibson and Blake McDowell (ca. 1970s). Black & white prints and one color transparency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Twenty-one b&w photos, most personal, of James L. Knight, and family: 1) JL, Mary Ann and daughters Beverly and Marjorie, c. 1960; 2/3) JL with daughter, Marjorie K. Crane and with Mary Ann, and Marjorie and Alpo Crane on their wedding day, 12/18/1964; 4) JL (in black tie) & Mary Ann; 5) JL and Mary Ann with Marjorie Crane (holding daughter Michelle), Beverly and Mr. and Mrs. Crane; 6) JL with granson, Christopher "Kitt" Toomey, 12/1964; 7/8) JL with grandsons Kenny North and Jim Toomey, 12/1966; 9) JL's daughters on Beverly's wedding day: Marilyn, Barbara, Beverly, Marjorie; 10) JL with golfing buddies; 11/12) JL fishing in the Florida keys, 1970; 13) JL with family in Charlotte, NC, with Reed Toomey, Marilyn North, Marjorie Crane, Mary Ann, Barbara Toomey and Beverly Olson; 14) JL salmon fishing with friend, 1970; 15/16) JL at reception at Finnish Embassy, Washington DC, where he received a medal, with daughter Marjorie, and with Mary Ann and the Finnish ambassador, 6/1970; 17) JL holding chicken; 18/19) JL and Mary Ann with Crane grandchildren, c. 1976; 20) JL with Crane grandchildren, 1978; 21) JL with Lee Hills and Marjorie and other family members and friends celebrating Christmas at Indian Creek Club, 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four b&w photos of JL at his Miami Herald retirement dinner, 1976: 1) JL (holding bird in cage), Mary Ann with daughters and sons-in-law; 2/3) JL, Mary Ann and daughters; 4) JL and Mary Ann (hidden) with daughters and sons-in-law (Beverly at lectern)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four b&w photos of JL and Mary Ann, with family and friends at their 40th Wedding Anniversary celebration, c. 1970s: 1) JL and Mary Ann seated at a table (Lee Hills in background); 2) JL , with Jim Carmine and Rad Crane (father of JL's son-in-law); 3) Marjorie and Beverly; 4) Marjorie, Mary Ann and Beverly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two b&w photos of JL and Mary Ann: 1) at ground-breaking ceremony for the Mary Ann and James L. Knight Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Imaging Center at Mount Sinai Medical Center, c. 1984; with Beverly and her son Charles, c. 1984/5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Willliam Friday, Chairman of the Knight Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics, including photographs of Mr. Friday and Creed Black at the University of North Carolina, Distinguished Professorship Dinner (Mr. Friday spoke at the event). Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of Lori Gross, Project Manager of the Museum Art Loan Project, about 1995. Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One b&w photograph of Christopher B. (Kit) Morris, who was appointed staff director of the Knight Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Color portrait of Robbie Adams, communications associate - webmaster, 2002 -- (4 copies).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of Sharon Anderson-Nearn, Cities Program Officer, 1990. Black & white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Color portraits of John Bare, Director of Evaluation (1997-2004) (4 copies/ I negative).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: B/w portrait of Thor Barraclough, communications associate - webmaster, 2001-2002 (2 copies).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: B/w portrait of Judith Bernstein, communications assistant (2 copies).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Formal and informal photographs (black & white, color, and negatives) of Creed C. Black, KF President (1987-1998), including images at speaking engagements, a Knight Commission event, with Elizabeth Dole, Ross Perot, Elsa (his wife), and others (three folders). did.unittitle: Sharpen the Focus and Heighten the Impact Cities Program Associates Meeting - Rod Petrey, Creed Black, Lee Hills (Part 1)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting involving Knight Foundation staff and consultants and Knight-Ridder community associates (later advisors). The meeting was designed to provide the associates with information about Knight's strategic planning process and to gather input from the group on how to make the process better. Included are remarks by Lee Hills, Creed Black, Rod Petrey (Foundation legal counsel), Rolfe Neill, and James Batten. A small amount of the group discussion was recorded.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.p: One audio cassette of speech made by Creed Black to the Akron Roundtable. A question and answer period is at the end. Topics include relocation of Knight Foundation, the Knight Commission of ICA, and Akron area grants.

scopecontent.p: 33 slides of images from the Compact Disk created to celebrate the dedication of Lee Hills Hall. Contains photographs of Lee Hills from his childhood through his career.

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight in printing room

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Negative of the brothers in a printing room. Image of portrait on display in KF headquarters. Also included is a cd of the image, in color, in a highest resolution tif file.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Informal portraits of Mr. Black by Pelham Photographic Services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Individual portraits (negatives only) of Knight Foundation staff and trustees taken for the 1998 Annual Report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group photograph of the Board of Trustees for the 1987 annual report. Includes Alvah Chapman, Barbara Toomey, Henry King Stanford, C.C. Gibson, Gerald Austen, Lee Hills and James L. Knight. Negatives only. Color.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six slides of a photograph of the Board of Trustees taken ca. 1989 for the annual report. The photographer was Lynn Pelham. Pictured are: James L. Knight, Lee Hills, Alvah Chapman, Barbara Knight Toomey, Henry King Stanford, C.C. Gibson and Gordon Heffern.

did.unittitle: Magic of Music Orchestra Initiative Retreat

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magic of Music Orchestra Initiative Retreat in Portland, Oregeon. Four sheets of negatives, with contact sheets. Alan Borrud, photographer.

did.unittitle: Magic of Music Orchestra Initiative Retreat

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magic of Music Orchestra Initiative Retreat at Brooklyn, New York. Slides are of participants and include Penny McPhee, Lisa Versaci, and MofM consultant Tom Wolf. Includes a demonstration of the Concert Companion on PDA (a hand-held computer with screen) by Roland Valiere. Contains 200 slides in sleeves. Most labeled.

did.unittitle: Magic of Music Orchestra Initiative - Wichita Symphony

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wichita Symphony, a Magic of Music Orchestra, performance including a cowboy, lariat cow roper, Native American, barbershop quartet and audience participation. Contains 12 color slides and a model release.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transparencies and negative of photograph taken for Annual Report Cover, 1993. Color and black & white.
